page.title: 07Churches in Silverdale
page.content: There are six churches in the village of Silverdale.St.Luke's C of E church is 132 years old.It was built in 1853 of stone,mostly sandstone, and wood.It has a broach spire and tower.The belfry houses the traditional eight bells.The clock on the tower was placed there in memory of the villagers who died in the two world wars.The symbols of the four gospel writers are to be found in carvings and paintings throughout the church. The Church of the Sacred Heart is a Roman Catholic church with a very unusual shape,that of an upturned boat. The Elim Pentecostal is a very modern church situated in High Street.The United Reform Church is in Victoria St, the Silverdale Methodist Church is to be found in Earl Street and finally there is the Bethel Temple in the Rookery.
